info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 3:01PM EDT until March 31 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Isle of Wight County in southeastern Virginia... Southampton County in southeastern Virginia... Southeastern Sussex County in southeastern Virginia... * Until 330 PM EDT. * At 301 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northwest of Newsoms, or 8 miles north of Boykins, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Courtland around 310 PM EDT. Sedley around 320 PM EDT. Wakefield and Ivor around 330 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Vicksville, Whitley, Dory, Berlin, Sebrell, Drewryville, Manry, Joyner, Shiloh and Worrell. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.
